sentence.Network_en: He must have picked up a cold — he's begun to snuffle.
sentence.Network_cn: 他开始鼻塞,一定是感冒了.

sentence.Network_en: He had a cold and spoke with a slight snuffle.
sentence.Network_cn: 他感冒了,说话有点齉鼻儿.

sentence.Network_en: He heard a snuffle behind him - a half - choking gasp or cough.
sentence.Network_cn: 他听到背后有一种吸鼻子的声音 -- 仿佛喘不出气或者咳嗽的声音.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: probably from Low German and Dutch snuffelen; compare with snuff and snivel

entry.def: If a person or an animal snuffles, they breathe in noisily through their nose, for example because they have a cold.

example.ex: She snuffled and wiped her nose on the back of her hand.
example.tran: 她抽了抽鼻子并用手背擦了擦。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of breathing heavily through the nose (as when the nose is congested)
2. snuff up mucus through the nose

sentences.sentence: "Stop snivelling--you got yourself into this mess!"

auth_sentence.content: Medieval life frolics around the walls and, hidden under a spray of oak leaves, two small pigs snuffle through the acorns.
auth_sentence.res_content: Medieval life frolics around the walls and, hidden under a spray of oak leaves, two small pigs snuffle through the acorns.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Medieval life frolics around the walls and, hidden under a spray of oak leaves, two small pigs snuffle through the acorns.

auth_sentence.content: When we walked at night, the cows, curious about us, would breathe and snuffle, sometimes scaring our city friends.
auth_sentence.res_content: When we walked at night, the cows, curious about us, would breathe and snuffle, sometimes scaring our city friends.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When we walked at night, the cows, curious about us, would breathe and snuffle, sometimes scaring our city friends.

sentences.en: He must have picked up a cold—he’s begun to snuffle.
sentences.cn: 他开始鼻塞,一定是感冒了。

sentences.en: According to research, non-drinkers are more likely to develop the winter snuffles than moderate drinkers.
sentences.cn: 据研究,不喝酒的人比适度喝酒的人冬天更容易感冒。
